If the player has the supreme tadpole, they can still assimilate Orpheus.

AD_OrpheusReadyToLeave.synopsis: Orpheus has been freed and has opened a portal back to Morphic Pool. He stands ready for the player to initiate their return to confront the Netherbrain.

Assimilation.synopsis: The player must now make a choice that will direct how the ending will potentially play out.Main decisions: - Give the Emperor the stones - Keep the stones - Become a full Mind Flayer - Reject the Emperor's solutions-  Free Orpheus

PAD_OrpheusAssimilationReaction.synopsis: The players just witnessed Orpheus being consumed

Orpheus_Dead.synopsis: Orpheus' brain has been sucked out of his skull. Attempting to cast Speak with Dead on his corpse will not provide much to work with.

OrpheusFreed.synopsis: Orpheus is now freed from the player's assistance. They now have the option to take the Mind Flayer form, or to give Orpheus that responsibility. He is not really impressed with the tadpole in the player's head. It's possible the player would have fought Orpheus in Intermezzo before this point, so there should be some reactivity to it.
OrpheusFreed.how_to_trigger: oe end_startillithidoptionsFinish dialogAttack the emperorTalk to Raphael to get the hammerBreak crystals with hammer to free Orpheusor oe end_freeorpheus

EmperorProposal.synopsis: The player has just narrowly escaped into the Astral Prism from the Netherbrain Mind Arena with the help from the Emperor. The Emperor acknowledges that the brain is too powerful for us to defeat it without making a great sacrifice.

PAD_TransformationReaction.synopsis: The party reacts to the player transforming into a Mind Flayer.
PAD_TransformationReaction.how_to_trigger: Get supreme tadpole from the EmperorUse it by full party

GD_Undecided.synopsis: The party discuss what just occurred and what to do about their current situation.They failed to kill the Netherbrain and the Emperor has other plans in mind. Gale and Lae'zel are given a higher priority here since Gale has the bomb in his chest and Lae'zel may want to free Orpheus.The main topics:1. What Is Happening2.  Distrust3. Hope
GD_Undecided.how_to_trigger: Act 3 > Endgame > Astral Plane > Trigger END_IllithidOptions_EmperorProposal > GD

MorphicPoolReturn.synopsis: Player has finished making their decision in the Astral Prism and returns to the Morphic Pool with the Emperor, Orpheus, or alone to the sight of the huge hole in the ceiling left by the brain on its way to the city.
MorphicPoolReturn.how_to_trigger: Act3 > Endgame > Play through Astral Plane > Return to Morphic Pool.

AD_RaphaelAppears.synopsis: The player betrayed the Emperor and don't have the Orphic Hammer to free Orpheus. Raphael appears to the rescue...for a price.

RaphaelLastChance.synopsis: The player has burned their bridges. They attacked the Emperor, causing him to leave the Astral Prism as a foe, and they have no hammer to free Orpheus, as they need his protection against the influence of the Netherbrain. After a short pause to let the players feel the weight of their actions, Raphael appears before them, with a new deal: accept the hammer from Raphael, freeing Orpheus in exchange for giving him the Crown. At this point, the player has no other option except for a game over.
RaphaelLastChance.how_to_trigger: Load END_Mainoe end_startillithidoptionsfollow the Emperor to the assimilation point (near Orpheus)Attack the EmperorWait for Raphael to appear

EmperorBetrayal.synopsis: The player has made the decision to attack the Emperor or free Orpheus. He is not really pleased about the player pushing away his support and leaves the astral prism promptly.
EmperorBetrayal.how_to_trigger: Load END_MainProgress to astral prism (oe end_startillithidoptions)Attack the Emperor/Tell the Emperor you are going to free Orpheus/Free Orpheus

GD_TadpoleChoice.synopsis:
Roles: No Compromise, At Any Cost, Bridge, Karlach
, Orpheus Path Lae'zelAll companions can fill all these roles, so the roles should not be seen as a hard stance in a debate, but the speakers to highlight the risks and options of the big decision. So player questions should remain open ended, asking for party feedback and not telling the party what they will do.

No Compromise: Why they can't be the one to transform, the risks involved, can they trust the Emperor? Some sub nodes should have different reactivity in the case they are already partial illithid, or were open to using the powers but never did

At Any Cost: Why the player needs to be the one to transform, why these decisions may be necessary, the stakes at hand

Bridge: The bridge between the two other topics, to facilitate the and direct the discussion and return the questions back to the player.

Karlach: The only one who can take the players place as the party Mind Flayer. With three companions, she replaces the bridge in most cases. Two companions she replaces the At Any Cost. Orpheus Path Lae'zel:Always in the "No Compromise" speaker slot, her only mission is to save Orpheus. If the player decides to allow Orpheus to be assimilated, she will interect with a high possibility of leaving the party and fighting the player if they refuse to change their mind.

This dialog is about the avatar and what they should do, but the decision is not made here as it's possible the player can change their mind when they return to gameplay or talk to the Emperor. This is a discussion of their available options, their feelings towards them, and why the player needs to be the one to transform (exception being Karlach). Their is a risk the player may feel sour towards their team for the perceived cowardice, as almost all of them are not willing to transform. This dialog will need to sell why the player is the hero of this story.

AD_EmperorWaiting.synopsis: The Emperor stands near Orpheus, waiting for the player to start discussing their options. He knows what must be done and needs the players support to do so.
AD_EmperorWaiting.how_to_trigger: Load END_Mainoe end_startillithidoptionsProceed till the Emperor is standing by OrpheusWait for ADs

AD_RaphaelWaiting_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_RaphaelWaiting_0.text: Tick tock. You can't avoid talking to me forever. Didn't your mother ever tell you not to keep a devil waiting?

AD_RaphaelWaiting_1.speaker: Raphael
AD_RaphaelWaiting_1.text: Such power in such a weak package. A prince no less.

AD_RaphaelWaiting_2.speaker: Raphael
AD_RaphaelWaiting_2.text: Those shackles look rather fetching on you, Orpheus. Shame about the imprisonment.

AD_RaphaelWaiting_3.speaker: Raphael
AD_RaphaelWaiting_3.text: Still in denial, are we? Cute. But you can't avoid me forever. You need me.

AD_OrpheusShacklesBroken_1.speaker: Orpheus
AD_OrpheusShacklesBroken_1.context: NodeContext: The sound is him breaking free of the chains that have imprisoned him for eons. Not the physical sound of exertion, but the mental expression of a mind returning to itself in full.

PAD_OutOfOptions_0.speaker: Player
PAD_OutOfOptions_0.text: Looks like we're out of options...

PAD_OutOfOptions_2.speaker: Player
PAD_OutOfOptions_2.text: We still have the tadpole - we could become illithid and assimilate Orpheus.

PAD_OutOfOptions_4.speaker: Player
PAD_OutOfOptions_4.text: And as long as Orpheus is chained, he can't help us.

PAD_OutOfOptions_1.speaker: Player
PAD_OutOfOptions_1.text: We have the hammer - we can free Orpheus.

PAD_OutOfOptions_3.speaker: Player
PAD_OutOfOptions_3.text: Wouldn't expect him to be very friendly after an aeon of captivity.

AD_OrpheusWaitingForChoice_0.speaker: Orpheus
AD_OrpheusWaitingForChoice_0.text: Quickly now - even here, we do not have infinite time.

AD_OrpheusWaitingForChoice_1.speaker: Orpheus
AD_OrpheusWaitingForChoice_1.text: The Netherbrain will not delay its Grand Design on account of your indecision.

AD_OrpheusWaitingForChoice_2.speaker: Orpheus
AD_OrpheusWaitingForChoice_2.text: Have you come to a decision?

AD_OrpheusWaitingForChoice_3.speaker: Orpheus
AD_OrpheusWaitingForChoice_3.text: You test my patience. There's only one intelligent choice - make it.

AD_OrpheusReadyToLeave_0.speaker: Orpheus
AD_OrpheusReadyToLeave_0.text: Come, I have made my sacrifice. It's time to end the Grand Design.

Assimilation_322.text: I came to you as a leader, but I did not shy away from showing you vulnerability. I needed you as much as you needed me. I was not above recognising this.

Assimilation_350.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_350.text: When you discovered my true identity, I did not flinch from truth - I never lied to you, not once. I am just like you. We have the same enemy, the same story.

Assimilation_147.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_147.text: I encouraged you to fulfil your potential, all while protecting you from harm.

Assimilation_385.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_385.text: And when you saw what I truly am - you did not reject me. You enjoyed me.

Assimilation_246.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_246.text: Now I ask you for the last time to trust me. Release the Netherstones to me.

Assimilation_37.speaker: Narrator
Assimilation_37.text: *You feel Lae'zel's parasite tremble. Her mind speaks directly to yours.*

Assimilation_259.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_259.text: There is another path. We yet hold the Hammer. We might still free Orpheus and strike him down!
Assimilation_259.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld over at end of line

Assimilation_222.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_222.text: I figured this abominable alliance at an end. But I fear we may have no choice.

Assimilation_240.speaker: Gale
Assimilation_240.text: Do not forget - there's a card yet to come into play. The orb. If we do not want to surrender the stones, I could still use it to ensure the brain's destruction. Along with my own, of course.
Assimilation_240.context: NodeContext: Knows he has t mention this, but really doesn't want to. Willing to go through with it though

Assimilation_334.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_334.text: This is a risk we cannot take. Your hubris drives you even now. You failed before, I cannot trust that you will not fail again.

Assimilation_391.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_391.text: You must trust me. Hand me the stones.

Assimilation_315.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_315.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player raises their hands towards the stones, which float like Ioun stones around their head, psionically guiding the stones towards the Emperor. With a tug of its hand towards its body, the Emperor pulls the netherstones from the player into its palm, and closes its fingers around them.

Assimilation_132.speaker: Player
Assimilation_132.text: I trust you. But I want to wield the stones - I want to be a mind flayer.

Assimilation_271.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_271.text: We carry the means of the prince's release - and his death. This cannot be the way!

Assimilation_237.speaker: Shadowheart
Assimilation_237.text: Have you lost your senses? All we've been through, and you just give in to ceremorphosis now?!

Assimilation_268.speaker: Astarion
Assimilation_268.text: You're joking. Please tell me you're joking.
Assimilation_268.context: NodeContext: Very concerned - player just said they want to turn into a mindflayer

Assimilation_200.speaker: Wyll
Assimilation_200.text: Have you gone mad? The time we've spent avoiding this horrific fate, and now you'd succumb to it?

Assimilation_256.speaker: Gale
Assimilation_256.text: Have you lost your wits?! You must not do this!

Assimilation_178.speaker: Karlach
Assimilation_178.context: NodeContext: Karlach reacting in shock and anger and confusion to the player saying they want to be a mindflayer

Assimilation_384.speaker: Halsin
Assimilation_384.text: No - have you taken leave of your senses?!

Assimilation_7.speaker: Jaheira
Assimilation_7.text: No. No - you cannot do this.

Assimilation_286.speaker: Minsc
Assimilation_286.text: Mourn, Boo - weep! The parasite has finally eaten our friend's brain!

Assimilation_2.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Assimilation_2.context: NodeContext: shock and sorrow - her lover just offered to sacrifice themselves and become a mind flayer

Assimilation_311.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_311.text: Very well. I have the means to evolve you.

Assimilation_49.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_49.text: I took this one from the nautiloid. I have been nurturing it ever since - priming it for your use.
Assimilation_49.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor produces the |supreme tadpole|, psionically levitates it in his hand. 
With a gesture of his hand, mind flayer psionically moves player's hand up, palm out, ready to receive.
Mind flayer hand drops tadpole in player's palm.
Shot of supreme tadpole squirming in player's palm. 
Shot of player's expression reacting to it.

Assimilation_1.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_1.text: It is not dissimilar to the experience you already had with the previous one. Only this one is much more potent.

Assimilation_139.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_139.text: All you have to do is open your mind to it. Its latent potential will do the rest.
Assimilation_139.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor rotates orpheus down into position for cronching

Assimilation_61.speaker: Player
Assimilation_61.text: What will it do to me exactly?

Assimilation_371.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_371.text: It will trigger ceremorphosis to completion.

Assimilation_32.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_32.text: First, you will feel discomfort. Then - flourishing.

Assimilation_335.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_335.text: You will transform into something superior - the full potential of your tadpole present in every sinew, every nerve. Pure thought, pure power.

Assimilation_98.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_98.text: You will be capable of dominating a Netherbrain.

Assimilation_158.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_158.text: Yes. But if my own experience is anything to go by - you will have no regrets.

Assimilation_19.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_19.text: You will see the world as I do - its truth, its devastating beauty.

Assimilation_402.speaker: Player
Assimilation_402.text: Open your mind to the parasite.

Assimilation_239.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player does a mindmeld effect and telepathically absorbs the tadpole. As they do so, the tadpole turns to particles that move towards their head, leaving nothing behind. Once the tadpole is absorbed, player turns into mind flayer. Reference gameplay animation that exists, but more elaborate and cinematic.

Assimilation_250.speaker: Narrator
Assimilation_250.text: *The boundary between thought and feeling is gone. Your mind and body are as one - bristling with concentrated cerebral energy.*
Assimilation_250.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player examines their new mind flayer form.

Assimilation_388.speaker: Narrator
Assimilation_388.text: *But there is something else - an emptiness to be filled, a hunger to be sated. It is overwhelming.*

Assimilation_317.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_317.text: You feel it, don't you, the hunger? Embrace it. Feed.

Assimilation_134.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach as mind flayer looks around at their terrified companions, hungrily, and then turns to Orpheus and lunges.

Assimilation_48.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Karlach (as a mind flayer) wraps their tentacles around Orpheus' face and brings their mouth over Orpheus' head. 
Karlach feeds CLUMSILY. Suckling noises.
Orpheus' eyes dart around in pain as his brain is consumed.
Once it's done, Orpheus' head flops to the side, his head empty.

Assimilation_379.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_379.text: Tsk'va. The false prince is dead - and you wield his power as ghaik.
Assimilation_379.context: NodeContext: Not quite triumphant - she is still concerned about

Assimilation_249.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_249.text: My queen will see the truth and know this was the way forward. She will greet me in Tu'narath as the Comet's destroyer, the prince's ruin.
Assimilation_249.context: NodeContext: too-NAHR-eth. Not quite triumphant - she is still concerned about

Assimilation_300.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_300.text: I'm sure you will learn how to do it more gracefully with time.
Assimilation_300.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor wipes brain gunk off its face from our messy eating.

Assimilation_53.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_53.text: But you have done what is necessary.

Assimilation_265.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_265.text: The greater challenge now lies ahead of us - the Netherbrain.

Assimilation_343.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_343.text: Come, we must follow the brain's path. This time, we will not fail.

Assimilation_254.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_254.context: NodeContext: KRAYTH-rak - meaning heresy. Visceral and guttural response.

Assimilation_342.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_342.text: I thought you my true kin. But you would keep your own people chained to their damnable queen!

Assimilation_332.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_332.text: We have the means to free Prince Orpheus - and you side with ghaik!

Assimilation_333.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_333.context: NodeContext: angry with betrayal and hurt

Assimilation_60.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_60.text: You want Orpheus dead? You'll have to kill me first.
Assimilation_60.context: NodeContext: she has only hatred left

Assimilation_41.speaker: Player
Assimilation_41.text: This is the only way, Lae'zel. You know it just as well as I do.

Assimilation_381.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_381.text: Lies! You have been seduced by empty promises, ghaik tricks!

Assimilation_165.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_165.text: To think I ever hoped for more from you...
Assimilation_165.context: NodeContext: coming down from rage to seething anger

Assimilation_236.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_236.text: You have damned my people for eternity.

Assimilation_28.speaker: Player
Assimilation_28.text: I trust the Emperor more than I trust Orpheus.

Assimilation_111.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_111.text: To think I trusted you. At best you are a ghaik pawn. At worst, you are a coward.

Assimilation_348.speaker: Player
Assimilation_348.text: We may as well trust the Emperor - it already has the stones.
Assimilation_348.context: InternalNodeContext: If the player already gave the stones to the Emperor, betraying him by this point is game over

Assimilation_119.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_119.text: They are correct. Facing the Netherbrain without you would not be easy, but I will do it if I must.

Assimilation_301.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_301.text: Only a newborn could be so naive.

Assimilation_10.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_10.text: It manipulates you. It's made you its thrall. And you blindly totter your way to oblivion.

Assimilation_393.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_393.text: Assimilate Orpheus, and I will rip off your every limb and bask in your agony!
Assimilation_393.context: NodeContext: hatred into self-loathing and resolve

Assimilation_247.speaker: Player
Assimilation_247.text: Wait - we can still free Orpheus.

Assimilation_140.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_140.text: You forget - I have the stones. Without them, you will accomplish nothing.

Assimilation_44.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_44.text: So the githyanki lives, what then are you left with? What ideas remain untested?

Assimilation_383.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_383.text: How will you defeat a Netherbrain?

Assimilation_354.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_354.text: Your only choice is to trust me.

Assimilation_309.speaker: Player
Assimilation_309.text: You're right, Lae'zel. We cannot let Orpheus be assimilated.

Assimilation_4.speaker: Player
Assimilation_4.text: I know how big this is to you, but trust me Lae'zel. Trust me.

Assimilation_9.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_9.text: We will end the Grand Design. And then we will go our separate ways.

Assimilation_126.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_126.text: No more words. I gave you my trust - and you failed me.

Assimilation_76.speaker: Player
Assimilation_76.text: We have no way to free Orpheus. Assimilation is our only option.

Assimilation_50.speaker: Player
Assimilation_50.text: Fool. You can't defeat the Netherbrain and end the Grand Design on your own.

Assimilation_96.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_96.text: To think I once called you zhak vo'n'fynh duj...

Assimilation_118.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_118.context: NodeContext: HTA-lak KRITH ma-HAR! - Die, treacherous scum!

Assimilation_215.speaker: Player
Assimilation_215.text: If it means that much to you, Lae'zel, I won't kill Orpheus.

Assimilation_376.speaker: Player
Assimilation_376.text: We'll find another way. I will not sacrifice Orpheus.

Assimilation_399.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_399.text: So easily persuaded, so quick to turn...

Assimilation_12.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_12.text: I am glad to have uncovered your weakness before facing the Netherbrain.

Assimilation_74.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_74.text: My chances of success would have been improved by your presence. But no matter, I will do what must be done. Alone.

Assimilation_207.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_207.text: I will assimilate Orpheus. And without his protection, you will perish. Just like I said you would.

Assimilation_401.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_401.text: You would keep my people chained to their damnable queen. I should've trusted my gut, driven a blade through your throat at first chance.

Assimilation_124.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player as mind flayer looks around at their terrified companions, hungrily, and then turns to Orpheus and lunges.

Assimilation_273.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Player (as a mind flayer) wraps their tentacles around Orpheus' face and brings their mouth over Orpheus' head. 
Player feeds CLUMSILY. Suckling noises.
Orpheus' eyes dart around in pain as his brain is consumed.
Once it's done, Orpheus' head flops to the side, his head empty.

Assimilation_157.speaker: Player
Assimilation_157.text: If Gale's solution doesn't work, you have my word - I will do what is necessary.

Assimilation_327.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_327.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stows the supreme tadpole away.

Assimilation_152.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_152.text: You will need to be fully illithid before you confront the Netherbrain.

Assimilation_303.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_303.text: Now stand aside. I will assimilate the githyanki's power in your stead.

Assimilation_208.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor 'powers down' the globe of domination (aka with a gesture of his hand, he waves it away so that Orpheus is accessible.)

Assimilation_386.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor wraps its tentacles around Orpheus' face and brinngs its mouth over Orpheus' head. Suckling noises as it feeds. 
Orpheus' eyes dart around in pain as his brain is consumed.
Once it's done, Orpheus' head flops to the side, his head empty.

Assimilation_95.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of player wiping brain gunk from their eye with disgust.

Assimilation_358.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_358.text: Tsk'va. The false prince is dead, his power taken to end the ghaik Grand Design.
Assimilation_358.context: NodeContext: Not quite triumphant - she is still concerned about

Assimilation_108.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_108.text: We hold the Hammer in hand, and you stood against me. Still - I see a path to ascension.

Assimilation_191.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_191.text: My queen will see the truth and know this was the way forward. She will greet me in Tu'narath as the Comet's destroyer, the prince's ruin.
Assimilation_191.context: NodeContext: too-NAHR-eth. Not quite triumphant - she is still concerned about

Assimilation_54.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Assimilation_54.text: Good. I would rather put my trust in you than in that thing.
Assimilation_54.context: NodeContext: disgust on final word - she's talking about the Emperor, the party's 'friendly' mind flayer that she hasn't trusted since the minute she met it

Assimilation_353.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_353.text: Tsk'va. If this must be our sacrifice, so be it. The prince will fall, praise Vlaakith - and we will take his powers.

Assimilation_324.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_324.text: We will destroy the Netherbrain - and I will ascend to my queen's side!

Assimilation_190.speaker: Player
Assimilation_190.text: Why should I trust you? You withheld information from me at every turn.

Assimilation_115.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_115.text: It is true that I withheld reality. I showed Orpheus and his guard as evil beings.

Assimilation_122.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_122.text: And I appeared to you in the form of someone you would trust - someone who wasn't a mind flayer.

Assimilation_382.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_382.text: But I am a mind flayer.

Assimilation_338.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_338.text: Illusion is my language. Just as words and actions are yours.

Assimilation_328.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_328.text: Do not judge me for being true to myself. I have never judged you.

Assimilation_144.speaker: Player
Assimilation_144.text: Enough. I have the Hammer - I will free Orpheus!

Assimilation_289.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_289.text: You're lying. His chains are unbreakable. The only way to break them is -
Assimilation_289.context: NodeContext: cuts himself off as he figured it out

Assimilation_355.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_355.text: No... Impossible... You would have had to make a deal with the devil himself. And if you had, I would know. I have had access to your thoughts the entire -

Assimilation_13.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_13.text: That was the silence I felt, wasn't it? When I lost you?

Assimilation_22.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_22.text: You took the devil's deal. And lied to me.

Assimilation_253.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_253.text: And there I was thinking you trusted me.

Assimilation_387.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_387.text: The way that I trusted you.

Assimilation_235.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_235.text: It is a shame we could not have cooperated. Your powers of manipulation are quite something.

Assimilation_291.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_291.text: Very well. Since you will not work with me, you work against me.

Assimilation_142.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_142.text: You leave me no option but to join the Netherbrain.
Assimilation_142.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the Emperor leaves, the globe of domination 'powers down' (aka fizzles out now that the Emperor is no longer there to maintain it.)

Assimilation_128.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_128.text: After everything I've done for you.

Assimilation_262.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_262.text: I thought you understood the value of your freedom when you destroyed the contract that bound you to deliver the Crown.

Assimilation_339.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_339.text: But now you insist on freeing the githyanki, and risking everything we worked towards.

Assimilation_375.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_375.text: You choose to side with the devil.

Assimilation_187.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_187.text: You would free the githyanki, and risk everything we've worked towards.

Assimilation_258.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_258.text: I had hoped for better, but I can't say I'm surprised.

Assimilation_365.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_365.text: It was always in your nature to give in to temptation.

Assimilation_360.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_360.text: You reasoned well, but chose poorly.

Assimilation_326.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_326.text: I told you we have to trust one another.

Assimilation_16.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_16.text: I told you the githyanki would only want to kill you for what you are.

Assimilation_228.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_228.text: Still, you choose to break our alliance.

Assimilation_313.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_313.text: Even united, the Netherbrain was going to be an impossible enemy. But apart - we have no chance of survival.

Assimilation_72.speaker: Player
Assimilation_72.text: I still have the orb. I don't need the stones to destroy the brain, and the crown with it.

Assimilation_346.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_346.text: Your hubris drives you even now. You failed before, I cannot trust that you will not fail again.

Assimilation_117.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_117.text: If you insist on doing this, I cannot stop you. But there is a better way, a way in which you live.

Assimilation_155.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_155.text: Hand me the stones, Gale. It is the only way we will guarantee our success.

Assimilation_31.speaker: Player
Assimilation_31.text: Very well. But when the brain is defeated, the stones return to me.

Assimilation_260.speaker: Player
Assimilation_260.text: Enough. I have the Hammer - I will deal with Orpheus myself!

Assimilation_224.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_224.text: Assimilate him? Tsk'va! No, now is the time to liberate him!
Assimilation_224.context: CinematicNodeContext: spoken to player only NodeContext: Rising intensity.

Assimilation_11.speaker: Lae'zel
Assimilation_11.text: Assimilate him? Tsk'va! No - we must liberate him!
Assimilation_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: spoken to player only NodeContext: Rising intensity.

Assimilation_21.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_21.text: Impossible. You have no means of liberating the githyanki prince. If the Netherbrain is to fall, the prince must be assimilated.

Assimilation_248.speaker: Karlach
Assimilation_248.text: This fella and its ultimatums. But he's forgetting one thing.

Assimilation_283.speaker: Karlach
Assimilation_283.text: We could become illithid. I mean, I could. You could trust me to do what needs to be done.

Assimilation_184.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_184.text: There are important matters to discuss - I intend to discuss them with your leader. Send them to me.

Assimilation_270.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_270.text: I trust you have aired opinions and grievances, and made your decision? Are you ready to become a mind flayer?

Assimilation_349.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_349.text: I admire the githyanki, you know. What she lacked in foresight, she made up for with passion.

Assimilation_229.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_229.text: But passion is a consolation prize for those who lack intellect.

Assimilation_173.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_173.text: I am glad to see that you lack neither, and did what had to be done.

Assimilation_214.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_214.text: I am glad that not all of your companions are such slaves to it, and that one among you did what needed to be done.

Assimilation_269.speaker: The Emperor
Assimilation_269.text: Now enough of this distraction - we must assimilate Orpheus.

PAD_OrpheusAssimilationReaction_2.speaker: Player
PAD_OrpheusAssimilationReaction_2.text: I think I'm going to be sick...
PAD_OrpheusAssimilationReaction_2.context: NodeContext: [Astarion: "yhurk" = a mild "trying not to throw up" noise]

PAD_OrpheusAssimilationReaction_1.speaker: Player
PAD_OrpheusAssimilationReaction_1.text: Hope we made the right choice.

PAD_OrpheusAssimilationReaction_3.context: InternalNodeContext: To just avoid dialog failed events

Orpheus_Dead_0.speaker: Narrator
Orpheus_Dead_0.text: *The corpse has nothing to say. Its mind has been consumed. Whatever thoughts it once had are forever lost.*

OrpheusFreed_76.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_76.context: NodeContext: Mind flayer - abomination to Vlaakith!

OrpheusFreed_20.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_20.text: You. Ghaik. Ally of my abuser. You will face my retribution.

OrpheusFreed_91.speaker: Narrator
OrpheusFreed_91.text: *As the githyanki prince takes his blade, a silent cry pierces your head. It's unlike any sensation you've ever felt.*
OrpheusFreed_91.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus, freed, takes his shortsword out of the rock nearby and wields it, threateningly, ready to strike.

OrpheusFreed_199.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_199.text: You attempted to obliterate my mind for your own gain.

OrpheusFreed_62.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_62.text: You felled a githyanki ally as they attempted to defend me.

OrpheusFreed_399.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_399.text: And yet you freed me, and stand before me now - a living contradiction.

OrpheusFreed_32.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_32.text: What have you to say for yourself? Speak!

OrpheusFreed_467.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_467.text: It's Lae'zel's word that's kept you from losing your mind, so show some gratitude.

OrpheusFreed_294.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_294.text: Lae'zel's death was regrettable. But there will be many more if you don't help us defeat the Netherbrain.

OrpheusFreed_70.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_70.context: NodeContext: shocked to hear the player express emotion in a natural and sincere way

OrpheusFreed_240.speaker: Narrator
OrpheusFreed_240.text: *His eyes search your ally, interrogating it for signs of genuine emotion - and finds it.*
OrpheusFreed_240.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus glares at the party mind flayer.

OrpheusFreed_329.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_329.text: What did I expect? It is in your very nature to say whatever you think I need to hear to forgo your slaughter.
OrpheusFreed_329.context: NodeContext: muttering to himself, remembering that mind flayers are masters of manipulation

OrpheusFreed_217.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_217.text: You have spent too long with this ghaik. You think you can manipulate me.

OrpheusFreed_137.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_137.text: Your pretty words may have swayed others, ghaik, but they will not sway me.
OrpheusFreed_137.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressing the player mind flayer

OrpheusFreed_2.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_2.text: You are a blight on this world. And I will remove you from it. Htak'a!

OrpheusFreed_477.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_477.text: Yet here you stand, alive and still in control of your own mind. We have bigger problems now.

OrpheusFreed_109.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_109.text: I don't need to justify my actions to you. I have a Netherbrain to kill, and I will do it by any means necessary.

OrpheusFreed_69.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_69.text: I don't need to justify my actions to you. I have a Netherbrain to kill, and I will do it by any means necessary.

OrpheusFreed_282.speaker: Orpheus

OrpheusFreed_19.speaker: Orpheus

OrpheusFreed_333.text: Kill me, and the Grand Design will come to pass. Your people will become illithid.

OrpheusFreed_167.text: Your Majesty. The Prince of the Comet, Gith's true heir. It is an honour.

OrpheusFreed_36.text: Any worthy individual destined to become ghaik would've done so.

OrpheusFreed_25.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_25.text: My guard would have freed me, and I would have stopped the elder brain before it evolved into a Netherbrain.

OrpheusFreed_11.text: All that suffering - avoidable. Were it not for the choices you made.
