OrpheusFreed_304.text: ...In this we are aligned. I am obliged to overlook your transgressions.

OrpheusFreed_388.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_388.text: We will destroy the Netherbrain together, and put a stop to this nascent Empire before it expands into the stars.

OrpheusFreed_443.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_443.text: The queen demands your head. And I mean to take it.

OrpheusFreed_337.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_337.text: The queen demands your head. And I mean to take it.

OrpheusFreed_320.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_320.text: Foolish child. You would doom yourself to being the Netherbrain's thrall.

OrpheusFreed_15.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_15.text: If that's all you have to say, I'll just leave you here then.

OrpheusFreed_251.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_251.text: The ghaik was correct about one thing - the Netherbrain's power is beyond us.

OrpheusFreed_213.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_213.text: The hardest metal in the world would not cut through its mind, for it is made of thought itself.

OrpheusFreed_307.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_307.text: At this point, it will take an illithid to unleash the full potential of the Netherstones.

OrpheusFreed_562.speaker: Gale
OrpheusFreed_562.text: And it would take one wizard to unleash a cataclysm powerful enough to tear apart the brain's very being. We have no choice but to consider using the orb.
OrpheusFreed_562.context: NodeContext: Firm/determined - stepping up to the plate

OrpheusFreed_88.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_88.text: I do not know you, wizard, and I do not know this 'orb'.

OrpheusFreed_363.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_363.text: But what I do know is that we must not gamble with the fate of the world. I cannot simply depend upon your word.

OrpheusFreed_390.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_390.text: I've heard enough. My Queen demands your head. It is time I take it.

OrpheusFreed_289.speaker: Narrator
OrpheusFreed_289.text: *Vlaakith's greatest threat stands before you. But to end him would condemn you and your allies to be the Netherbrain's eternal thralls.*

OrpheusFreed_512.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_512.text: Someone will need to turn into a mind flayer. Are you willing to do that?

OrpheusFreed_22.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus looks down, pensive, sad - a long pause as he thinks about everything he wanted to do, everything he will be leaving behind, just as freedom was beckoning.

OrpheusFreed_341.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_341.context: NodeContext: having made up his mind and reached an awful conclusion

OrpheusFreed_111.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_111.text: I will become - illithid. I will sacrifice my soul for my people. I will end the Grand Design.
OrpheusFreed_111.context: NodeContext: with firmer resolve but choking on the phrase 'become illithid' - it's his worst nightmare, literally nauseating and devastating to him

OrpheusFreed_492.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_492.text: And yet you will live. A ghaik thrall wearing the skin of his masters at long last.

OrpheusFreed_559.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_559.text: Is this what you think? That I am an agent of the Illithid Empire?

OrpheusFreed_510.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_510.text: It is etched in slate. So says Vlaakith, and so it must be.

OrpheusFreed_231.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_231.text: My mission is eternal, immutable. Our path ends here, k'chakhi. On this day, Gith's son shall perish by my hands.

OrpheusFreed_106.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_106.text: My Prince, you cannot. This is not your burden to bear!

OrpheusFreed_186.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_186.text: All right, then. You are a true hero.

OrpheusFreed_426.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus puts out his hand. Player gives him the supreme tadpole. Orpheus looks disgusted and uncomfortable.

OrpheusFreed_521.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus |uses| the supreme tadpole and begins the Illithid transformation, which continues over the next nodes.

OrpheusFreed_422.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_422.text: Even in my darkest hours, I knew it was my destiny to save my people - I could never have imagined this would be the way.
OrpheusFreed_422.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus speaks while transforming into an Illithid.

OrpheusFreed_483.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_483.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus lifts his head to the stars, utters a prayer, and becomes full Illithid. NodeContext: 'Gith's light guides us' (Gith is his mother and the founder of all githyanki) [GITH-ka TAHV-keem KRASH-ht]

OrpheusFreed_456.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_456.context: CinematicNodeContext: Transformation over. Orpheus is Illithid and speaks telepathically now (like the Emperor.) The stones float over into his grasp. He looks at them with dismay for a beat before the next line.

OrpheusFreed_126.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_126.text: Let us seek out the Netherbrain and finish this.

OrpheusFreed_258.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_258.text: Once the Grand Design is ended, kill me. It is the very least you can do.

OrpheusFreed_496.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_496.text: Is this some sort of trick, or are you really so careless as to have misplaced it?

OrpheusFreed_3.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_3.text: G'lyck. Cursed to be in the presence of k'chakhi.
OrpheusFreed_3.context: NodeContext: g'lyck - 'geh-LIK' - githyanki sigh. k'chakhi - 'ke-CHOCK-ee' - idiots. Muttered to himself about the player, who he now considers an absolute imbecile.

OrpheusFreed_204.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_204.text: It seems that someone else took the responsibility that you could not. There is at least some honour amongst your ranks.

OrpheusFreed_447.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_447.text: There is no more for us to discuss.

OrpheusFreed_295.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_295.text: All right, then. Take the tadpole the Emperor gave.

OrpheusFreed_161.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_161.text: The Netherbrain will be only too pleased to claim me...
OrpheusFreed_161.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus brings his right hand to his temple on "pleased", looking down and pausing a beat, before dropping his hand and finishing the line.NodeContext: with bitter hatred of what he's about to do, even though he knows it's a noble sacrifice

OrpheusFreed_408.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_408.text: Keep your soul - your people need you. I will make the sacrifice.

OrpheusFreed_67.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_67.text: Vlaakith's mission is eternal, immutable. Our path ends here. On this day, Gith's son shall perish by my hands.

OrpheusFreed_397.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_397.text: Respond with the tadpole. 'We need Orpheus' protection. You can kill him when the Netherbrain's dead. I promise.'

OrpheusFreed_93.speaker: Narrator
OrpheusFreed_93.text: *A moment passes - and you feel Lae'zel relent.*

OrpheusFreed_73.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_73.text: Orpheus, rotten seed of great Mother Gith, shame of the Empire.

OrpheusFreed_290.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_290.text: No sight makes me sicker, no name kindles such rage.

OrpheusFreed_485.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_485.text: If I'm to end the Netherbrain and its Grand Design, it seems I must call you ally. But I will never call you my prince.

OrpheusFreed_267.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_267.text: Then we've nothing to discuss, disciple of Vlaakith.

OrpheusFreed_475.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_475.text: But you? You I've misjudged. You were testing my honour. And in so doing, you have convinced me of yours.

OrpheusFreed_506.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_506.text: Instead, witness the sight of true sacrifice.

OrpheusFreed_75.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_75.text: Kill Orpheus, and you hand victory to the brain. Is that what you want?

OrpheusFreed_508.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_508.text: Vlaakith will not let the Grand Design come to pass! In the Undying Queen, the githyanki are eternal.

OrpheusFreed_547.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_547.text: You've left me no choice, Lae'zel. I'm striking you down.

OrpheusFreed_292.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_292.text: Tsk'va! I see only vermin before me, primed for extermination. Orpheus will not be the only traitor to die this day.

OrpheusFreed_265.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_265.text: Let the histories show: Lae'zel of K'liir shattered the Prince of the Comet!

OrpheusFreed_479.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_479.text: I am with you, Lae'zel. Today, Orpheus dies.

OrpheusFreed_530.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_530.text: Slay me then if you can, in the knowledge that if you win, the Netherbrain will take your mind.

OrpheusFreed_48.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_48.text: You have given too much already. I will be illithid, I will bear the burden.

OrpheusFreed_328.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_328.text: It seems I misjudged  you. You were testing my honour. And in so doing, you have convinced me of yours.

OrpheusFreed_81.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_81.text: When the moment of transformation comes, you will be the one ghaik I salute instead of slaughter.

OrpheusFreed_417.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_417.text: My people will remember you, tiefling - the rebel illithid who stood beside their reborn prince and ended the Grand Design.

OrpheusFreed_54.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_54.text: My people will remember you - the rebel illithid who stood beside their reborn prince and ended the Grand Design.
OrpheusFreed_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus descends to one knee in respect to whichever player is the mind flayer.

OrpheusFreed_524.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_524.text: Let us return now to the city, and follow the path of the Netherbrain.

OrpheusFreed_507.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_507.text: So be it. But when the Grand Design is ended, I need the stones back.

OrpheusFreed_188.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_188.text: As you wish. They will be useless once they've served their purpose.

OrpheusFreed_379.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_379.text: There has to be another way.

OrpheusFreed_550.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_550.text: We face a Netherbrain. For there to be one way to defeat it is unlikely enough. There will not be another.

OrpheusFreed_449.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_449.text: I'm not becoming a mind flayer.

OrpheusFreed_471.speaker: Karlach
OrpheusFreed_471.text: Wait. Maybe you don't have to. It... it should be me.

OrpheusFreed_396.speaker: Karlach
OrpheusFreed_396.text: I'm dying. My heart feels like a live grenade - gonna blow any minute. You still have a life to live. I don't.

OrpheusFreed_364.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_364.text: This is my sacrifice to make. Not yours.

OrpheusFreed_72.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_72.text: This isn't your sacrifice to make.

OrpheusFreed_371.speaker: Karlach
OrpheusFreed_371.text: But it isn't a sacrifice. Not to me. I... I'm dying. This thing in my chest is burning me through.

OrpheusFreed_394.speaker: Karlach
OrpheusFreed_394.text: If this is the end for me, let me be the motherfucker who saved the world.

OrpheusFreed_98.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_98.text: If this is what you really want, all I can say is thank you.

OrpheusFreed_410.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_410.text: You. Tiefling. You would volunteer your life for the greater good. You would make the ultimate sacrifice. I thank you.

OrpheusFreed_340.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_340.text: The Netherbrain wants nothing more than to see all infected become ghaik.

OrpheusFreed_389.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_389.text: My defences keep the voice of the Absolute out, but just as I can raise them, so I can lower them.

OrpheusFreed_178.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_178.text: I will allow the voice of the Absolute in. Once it reaches you, it will order you to transform.

OrpheusFreed_271.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_271.text: It will only take a moment. And once you are a mind flayer, I will fold you under my protection once more.
OrpheusFreed_271.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

OrpheusFreed_40.speaker: Narrator
OrpheusFreed_40.text: *With the withdrawal of Orpheus' power, Karlach's mind is rushed with the full force of the Netherbrain.*
OrpheusFreed_40.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus puts two fingers to his temple.
Karlach is suddenly overcome.

OrpheusFreed_102.speaker: Narrator
OrpheusFreed_102.text: *The very fabric of her being is torn apart and reformed in an agonising process that is over all too soon.*
OrpheusFreed_102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach, in excruciating pain and ecstasy, transforms into a mind flayer. (Like gameplay animation, but more cinematic.)

OrpheusFreed_275.speaker: Narrator
OrpheusFreed_275.text: *Then - stillness as she stands transformed, once again closed off from the Netherbrain's mind.*
OrpheusFreed_275.context: CinematicNodeContext: Karlach stands there as a mind flayer.

OrpheusFreed_26.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_26.text: No, Karlach. This is for me to do. I'll embrace the parasite - I'll evolve.

OrpheusFreed_4.speaker: Karlach
OrpheusFreed_4.text: I know you. I know you know your own mind. If this is what you want, then all I can say is give 'em Hell, soldier.

OrpheusFreed_296.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_296.text: Fascinating. You take on the sacrifice, though you could have foisted your responsibility onto another. Perhaps I misjudged you.

OrpheusFreed_143.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_143.text: K'chakhi - I will hear no more of this nonsense.

OrpheusFreed_429.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_429.text: But your selflessness is misplaced. This is not a sacrifice for you to make - it is a burden for your leader.

OrpheusFreed_29.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_29.text: Do what you must to convince them. I will speak with them when they are ready to transform.

OrpheusFreed_306.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_306.text: The Netherbrain wants nothing more than to see all infected become ghaik.

OrpheusFreed_198.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_198.text: My defences keep the voice of the Absolute out, but just as I can raise them, so I can lower them.

OrpheusFreed_552.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_552.text: I will allow the voice of the Absolute in. Once it reaches you, it will order you to transform.

OrpheusFreed_372.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_372.text: It will only take a moment. And once you are a mind flayer, I will fold you under my protection once more.
OrpheusFreed_372.context: NodeContext: verbal grimace on 'mind flayer' - he can't hide his distate for this even when it's in service of a greater good

OrpheusFreed_504.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_504.text: You will be the saviour of empires, not least my own.
OrpheusFreed_504.context: CinematicNodeContext: [Cody] Orpheus brings his right hand to his temple on "empires," looking down and pausing a beat, before dropping his hand and finishing the line.

OrpheusFreed_358.speaker: Narrator
OrpheusFreed_358.text: *With the withdrawal of Orpheus' power, your mind is rushed with the full force of the Netherbrain.*
OrpheusFreed_358.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player is suddenly overcome.

OrpheusFreed_77.speaker: Narrator
OrpheusFreed_77.text: *You feel a compulsion unlike anything you've ever known - excruciating and exhilarating in equal measure. You wish nothing in the world but to evolve.*
OrpheusFreed_77.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player, in excruciating pain and ecstasy, transforms into a mind flayer. (Like gameplay animation, but more cinematic.)

OrpheusFreed_466.speaker: Narrator
OrpheusFreed_466.text: *Then - complete silence, as you are once again closed off from the Netherbrain's mind.*
OrpheusFreed_466.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player stands there as a mind flayer.

OrpheusFreed_332.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_332.text: My people will remember you, tiefling - the rebel illithid who stood beside their reborn prince and ended the Grand Design.

OrpheusFreed_159.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_159.text: Let us return now to the city, and follow the path of the Netherbrain.

OrpheusFreed_453.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_453.text: My people will remember you - the rebel illithid who stood beside their reborn prince and ended the Grand Design.
OrpheusFreed_453.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orpheus descends to one knee in respect to whichever player is the mind flayer.

OrpheusFreed_156.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_156.text: No, Karlach. This is for me to do. I'll embrace the parasite - I'll evolve.

OrpheusFreed_124.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_124.text: No - neither of us is turning into a mind flayer. Not now.

OrpheusFreed_532.speaker: Karlach
OrpheusFreed_532.text: You always were sensible. This heart inside me is about to blow. Doesn't matter which body it obliterates, right?

OrpheusFreed_216.speaker: Karlach
OrpheusFreed_216.text: Look, my offer is still on the table. I can do this. I should do this. You know you can trust me.
OrpheusFreed_216.context: NodeContext: A major moment. A major offer. A major sacrifice.

OrpheusFreed_385.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_385.text: Our people's future is at stake. I'll do as you say.

OrpheusFreed_404.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_404.text: I understand. If that's what it takes, I'll do it.

OrpheusFreed_319.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_319.text: I understand. If that's what it takes, I'll do it.

OrpheusFreed_190.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_190.text: There is honour within you yet. I commend this.

OrpheusFreed_424.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_424.text: I trust in Gale. You have my word.

OrpheusFreed_383.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_383.text: Your word means as little to me as his.

OrpheusFreed_342.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_342.text: He may destroy himself when the time comes, if he so chooses, I will have my assurances now.

OrpheusFreed_46.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_46.text: But I am fortunate... It seems that someone already took the responsibility that you could not. There is at least some honour amongst your ranks.

OrpheusFreed_130.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_130.text: One of us must transform, and we must do it right away.

OrpheusFreed_252.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_252.text: This isn't an easy decision. I need a moment to consider it.
OrpheusFreed_252.context: InternalNodeContext: For multiplayer, so if Sally is the speaker, but Bob wants to transform.

OrpheusFreed_327.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_327.text: Consider, yes, but know that it is not your burden to bear - the weight of it would crush you.

OrpheusFreed_242.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_242.text: It is your leader who must make the choice. It always is.
OrpheusFreed_242.context: NodeContext: 'It always is' muttered under his breath - he's talking about himself there

OrpheusFreed_218.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_218.text: Consider, yes. But know that the answer is already foretold. This is the only way to stop the Grand Design.

OrpheusFreed_406.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_406.text: Whatever prevents you from doing what is necessary - face it, overcome it.

OrpheusFreed_176.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_176.text: You are a threat to the githyanki order. Prepare for battle, traitor.

OrpheusFreed_415.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_415.text: If you kill me, it will be the end of you. And everything else. The Netherbrain will restore the Illithid Empire. Is that truly what you want?

OrpheusFreed_201.speaker: Narrator
OrpheusFreed_201.text: *You realise he is telling the truth. If you kill him, you are dooming everyone.*

OrpheusFreed_164.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_164.text: All right. Allies it is then.

OrpheusFreed_533.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_533.text: Allies? Shka'keth! I will hear no more of this nonsense.

OrpheusFreed_5.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_5.text: It seems I misjudged you. You are capable of sacrifice.

OrpheusFreed_237.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_237.text: Then you would condemn us all to the Grand Design.

OrpheusFreed_65.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_65.text: You must reconsider - this is the only way.

OrpheusFreed_200.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_200.text: Overcome whatever prevents you from doing the only thing that will guarantee your survival.

OrpheusFreed_189.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_189.text: Return to me when you are ready to transform.

OrpheusFreed_173.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_173.text: No more lies, traitor. You will not deny me my ascension.

OrpheusFreed_17.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_17.text: That will not be necessary. I can destroy the brain with a single spell - though it would kill me too.

OrpheusFreed_515.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_515.text: An honourable offer - to sacrifice yourself to save the world.

OrpheusFreed_266.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_266.text: But I do not know you, and the fate of the world cannot depend upon your word.

OrpheusFreed_165.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_165.text: I should have left you in your chains.

OrpheusFreed_148.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_148.text: And you should have surrendered yourself to my honour guard. They would have given you a noble end.

OrpheusFreed_256.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_256.text: I only freed you so that I could kill you.

OrpheusFreed_542.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_542.text: Your honour guard attacked me. What was I supposed to do?

OrpheusFreed_50.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_50.text: You should have yielded to them. They would have given you a noble end.

OrpheusFreed_411.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_411.text: The Undying Queen demands your head. I have come to take it.

OrpheusFreed_169.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_169.text: The Undying Queen demands your head. I have come to take it.

OrpheusFreed_505.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_505.text: The traitor prince. Vlaakith's would-be usurper.

OrpheusFreed_286.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_286.text: Speaking with him is pointless. He knows only the language of ghaik heresy.

OrpheusFreed_545.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_545.text: You stole an unborn hatchling from my people.

OrpheusFreed_357.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_357.text: You took advantage of my powers.

OrpheusFreed_465.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_465.text: I see you found it. And you had honour enough to use it. My people will thank you.

OrpheusFreed_487.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_487.text: The heretic child lives. Execute her as you said you would - then, we shall speak.

OrpheusFreed_491.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_491.context: NodeContext: Mind flayer - abomination to Vlaakith!

OrpheusFreed_413.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_413.text: You. Friend of ghaik. Ally of my abuser. You will face my retribution.

OrpheusFreed_513.speaker: Narrator
OrpheusFreed_513.text: *The hunger is too much to bear. Your nature is irresistible.*

OrpheusFreed_6.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_6.text: But perhaps you can still redeem yourself. And I may yet fulfil my destiny.

OrpheusFreed_557.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_557.text: Please - whatever Prince Orpheus asks of us, we must obey.

OrpheusFreed_463.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_463.text: Chk. The traitor's destiny is to adorn my queen's throne as a trophy.

OrpheusFreed_254.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_254.text: It is you who must transform.

OrpheusFreed_203.speaker: Player
OrpheusFreed_203.text: I'm not long for this world. It makes sense that it should be me.

OrpheusFreed_246.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_246.text: Then you would condemn us all to the Grand Design. Fortunately, you are not the one in control.

OrpheusFreed_336.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_336.text: You have no honour. And no sense. Even if I wanted to, I could not become a mind flayer. You are the one with the parasite in your head.

OrpheusFreed_468.speaker: Karlach
OrpheusFreed_468.text: Well. And me. Look, I'm not long for this world anyway. I should transform. Do what needs to be done.
OrpheusFreed_468.context: NodeContext: A major moment. A major offer. A major sacrifice.

OrpheusFreed_450.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_450.text: Since you drove the mind flayer away, you will need to become illithid in its place.

OrpheusFreed_362.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_362.text: This should not be too big a sacrifice for you. You are already halfway there.

OrpheusFreed_82.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_82.text: It's understandable that you've been resisting the prospect, but it is how you will earn your redemption.

OrpheusFreed_539.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_539.text: You understand nothing of duty, nor sacrifice.

OrpheusFreed_381.speaker: Lae'zel
OrpheusFreed_381.text: Enough of this. We take his head here and now.

OrpheusFreed_354.speaker: Orpheus
OrpheusFreed_354.text: Fool. The moment I fall, the Netherbrain takes you. Under my terms, you may be illithid - but your mind will be yours.

OrpheusFreed_551.speaker: Narrator
OrpheusFreed_551.text: *You may have resisted once, but your hunger remains unsated. And this is a truly fine specimen. Best not to tempt fate.*
OrpheusFreed_551.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Orpheus chained up, unresponsive. Same as N433.

EmperorProposal_14.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorProposal_14.text: I pulled you out just in time.
EmperorProposal_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: We see the Emperor looming over us as we wake up. First person POV blinking awake - callback to intro cinematic. Player sits up.

EmperorProposal_0.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorProposal_0.text: The situation is worse than I thought.

EmperorProposal_11.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorProposal_11.text: This is an elder brain no longer. The magic of the crown has caused it to evolve.

EmperorProposal_12.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorProposal_12.text: It has become something more - a Netherbrain.
EmperorProposal_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor pulls us to our feet psionically. We are battered and bruised.

EmperorProposal_16.speaker: Player
EmperorProposal_16.text: I thought the Netherstones were supposed to allow us to dominate the brain.

EmperorProposal_13.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorProposal_13.text: I thought so too. But that was when I believed it was still an elder brain.

EmperorProposal_17.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorProposal_17.text: I was as surprised as you were.

EmperorProposal_8.speaker: Player
EmperorProposal_8.text: It's a good thing we allied ourselves with Gortash.

EmperorProposal_19.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorProposal_19.text: It will take more than an alliance with Gortash to defeat the brain now.

EmperorProposal_4.speaker: Player
EmperorProposal_4.text: I'm glad you were there to save me.

EmperorProposal_5.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorProposal_5.text: Me too. We nearly lost everything.

EmperorProposal_10.speaker: Player
EmperorProposal_10.text: You pulled me out too soon - I nearly had it!

EmperorProposal_3.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorProposal_3.text: Do not exaggerate. You nearly died.

EmperorProposal_6.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorProposal_6.text: It has been anticipating our every move from the start.

EmperorProposal_9.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorProposal_9.text: We will need to rethink our plan.

PAD_TransformationReaction_0.speaker: Player
PAD_TransformationReaction_0.text: That looked... painful. To say the least.

GD_Undecided_129.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_129.text: The Emperor did this. Planned this, somehow. What's it hiding?

GD_Undecided_121.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_121.text: I have no love for the illithid - but its survival is bound to ours. That is as close to common cause as we will get.

GD_Undecided_68.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_68.text: Let's hear the Emperor out. We can make our minds up then.

GD_Undecided_78.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_78.text: |Best to make such decisions after thorough research.|

GD_Undecided_39.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_39.text: Hear, hear. Still hoping for a miracle, but I'm ready for whatever comes our way.

GD_Undecided_46.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_46.text: Whatever the Emperor has to say, I'm past the point of trusting it.

GD_Undecided_6.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_6.text: I'm not sure I ever really did. That thing is in it for itself, all the way.

GD_Undecided_109.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_109.text: |Then we'll need to make our next move carefully. While my option is available, I'm not eager to using it if it can be avoided.|

GD_Undecided_7.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_7.text: Trust me - unleashing the orb is not something I want to do, but if there's no other way...
GD_Undecided_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale gives a sage nod.

GD_Undecided_8.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_8.text: ...well, I shan't hesitate. We cannot allow this thing to prevail.
GD_Undecided_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale gives a sage nod.

GD_Undecided_3.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_3.text: The Emperor's plan only failed because the brain evolved - let's hear it out. It might have a solution yet.

GD_Undecided_13.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_13.text: The flayer makes a great show of having all the answers. Let us see if it can save its own skin.

GD_Undecided_85.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_85.text: We have another option - the orb. I could still put a stop to this... though at great cost.

GD_Undecided_97.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_97.text: And I thought myself the pragmatist. No, Gale - better to die for the right choice than live with the wrong one.

GD_Undecided_37.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_37.text: Not a price I really want to pay, but if we run out of options, we might have to fork up.

GD_Undecided_108.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_108.text: I think we should free Orpheus - perhaps he can help us where the Emperor failed.

GD_Undecided_43.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_43.text: The Emperor fears Orpheus. Do not expect it to stand idly by and see him freed.

GD_Undecided_83.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_83.text: Who cares what squiddie thinks? Our goal was never to save the damn thing. If Orpheus can help us, we should give him a chance.

GD_Undecided_9.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_9.text: The Emperor will no doubt seek to pour honey in our ears - talk us round to it's way of thinking. It would be remiss of me to not remind all that there is another way...

GD_Undecided_35.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_35.text: ... the orb. I still have the means to unleash its power, and put a stop to all this from one heartbeat to the next. But it would not be without cost. The city, and all who remain, would be lost.

GD_Undecided_27.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_27.text: It should not have to come to that. Perhaps the illithid can provide us with a better solution.

GD_Undecided_10.speaker: Narrator
GD_Undecided_10.text: *Discomfort gnaws at you like a rat in your belly - is it doubt? Or simply fear?*
GD_Undecided_10.context: NodeContext: 'guest' = the tadpole living in your head.

GD_Undecided_42.speaker: Narrator
GD_Undecided_42.text: *The stones were supposed to allow you to dominate the brain - the Emperor said so. But it didn't work.*

GD_Undecided_69.speaker: Narrator
GD_Undecided_69.text: *There is another way - the hammer that will free Orpheus. Perhaps the githyanki could help you succeed, where the mind flayer failed?*

GD_Undecided_66.speaker: Narrator
GD_Undecided_66.text: *If only you could free Orpheus, perhaps he could help you succeed where the Emperor failed?*

GD_Undecided_101.speaker: Narrator
GD_Undecided_101.text: *And then there's the fire in your chest, filling you with white, hot, power, ready to be released at any moment.*

GD_Undecided_72.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_72.text: Don't be daft. The Emperor misled us. Planned this whole thing. What's it hiding?

GD_Undecided_16.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_16.text: The Emperor will no doubt seek to pour honey in our ears - talk us round to it's way of thinking. It would be remiss of me to not remind all that there is another way...

GD_Undecided_31.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_31.text: ... the orb. I still have the means to unleash its power, and put a stop to all this from one heartbeat to the next. But it would not be without cost. The city, and all who remain, would be lost.

GD_Undecided_44.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_44.text: | So our choices are: Trust the scheming mindflayer or Disintegrate the Sword Coast... |

GD_Undecided_111.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_111.text: Let's hear what the Emperor has to say - we can make our minds up then.

GD_Undecided_76.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_76.text: That's it. Get the facts, then sort them out. Not like we have much of a choice to do otherwise.

GD_Undecided_102.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_102.text: The Emperor's plan failed. It's proven it can't be trusted.

GD_Undecided_52.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_52.text: |Then that will not leave us with many options left. Measure twice, cut once.|

GD_Undecided_60.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_60.text: Look at Gale, look down to his chest.

GD_Undecided_56.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_56.text: As keen as I am to survive, the option remains - and we have vanishingly few others. I daresay none.
GD_Undecided_56.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale gives a sage nod.

GD_Undecided_34.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_34.text: We may cling to hope a while longer if you wish, but should that fail us, I'll be ready to act.
GD_Undecided_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale gives a sage nod.

GD_Undecided_100.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_100.text: The Emperor's plan only failed because the brain has evolved - it might have another plan.

GD_Undecided_54.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_54.text: I'm willing to hear this so-called plan. Also willing to split the thing's skull open, but I can wait.

GD_Undecided_91.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_91.text: We have another option - the orb. I could still put a stop to this... though at great cost.

GD_Undecided_29.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_29.text: No, we cannot resort to that - not if there's even a glimmer of hope remaining. If we're willing to sacrifice a whole city of innocents, what are we even fighting for?

GD_Undecided_73.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_73.text: | I won't accept it. I won't. |

GD_Undecided_124.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_124.text: I say we free Orpheus. Perhaps he can help us where the Emperor failed.

GD_Undecided_80.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_80.text: |Nothing like a good one-two with a blunt object to shift negotiations, though it doesn't seem like the type to appreciate such crude methods.|

GD_Undecided_0.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_0.text: Who cares what the illithid thinks. If we can get Orpheus on our side, we're golden.

GD_Undecided_23.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_23.text: The Emperor will no doubt seek to pour honey in our ears - talk us round to it's way of thinking. It would be remiss of me to not remind all that there is another way...

GD_Undecided_105.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_105.text: ... the orb. I still have the means to unleash its power, and put a stop to all this from one heartbeat to the next. But it would not be without cost. The city, and all who remain, would be lost.

GD_Undecided_41.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_41.text: Why in the hells would we do that?!

GD_Undecided_118.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_118.text: The end is nigh, one way or another, and our options are dwindling in both quantity and quality.

GD_Undecided_132.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_132.text: You distrust the Emperor that much?

GD_Undecided_92.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_92.text: Honestly? I think putting trust in anyone but ourselves is foolhardy at this stage. One way or another, I think we amount to the best chance of stopping this.

GD_Undecided_120.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_120.text: That's not our only option - we could still free Orpheus.

GD_Undecided_113.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_113.text: A githyanki who might turn on us for being infected? That is not someone I'm eager to pin my hopes on.

GD_Undecided_86.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_86.text: Present company excluded of course - but the point remains. We cannot afford to trust your kin will react well to us.

GD_Undecided_45.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_45.text: The orb is not a choice that I relish... but it is not one we can afford to ignore.

GD_Undecided_67.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_67.text: Let's not rush to conclusions - we should at least hear what the Emperor has to say.

GD_Undecided_14.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_14.text: Hear him out if you wish - but please, don't act in haste.

GD_Undecided_30.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_30.text: Of course - I've had ample time to think on it. We may yet prevail by other means... but the option remains. And I shall not hesitate, if called upon.

GD_Undecided_115.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_115.text: Either way, I think we should free Orpheus.

GD_Undecided_93.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_93.text: If that is your wish, so be it... but the orb remains an option. And I shall not hesitate, if called upon.

GD_Undecided_90.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_90.text: We've gone astray. Foolish to think the Emperor would lead us to anything but ruin.

GD_Undecided_126.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_126.text: Whatever the ghaik proposes, we must have but one goal in mind: free Orpheus from his shackles.

GD_Undecided_114.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_114.text: The Prince of the Comet will reclaim the throne from the traitorous lich queen.

GD_Undecided_70.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_70.text: The Netherstones failed, the brain still lives. Orpheus is hardly my top concern.

GD_Undecided_53.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_53.text: Then you will make him your concern.

GD_Undecided_128.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_128.text: The Githyanki Empire is at a precipice - one wrong push, and it tumbles.

GD_Undecided_33.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_33.text: Let's talk to the Emperor first before we decide anything.

GD_Undecided_36.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_36.text: Watch your tone. I will do what's right, no more and no less.

GD_Undecided_106.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_106.text: My fate unravels, and you're concerned with my tone? Fagh wo'h chox, kainyank!
GD_Undecided_106.context: NodeContext: fahg woh CHALKS, cane-yank! (Fuck off, cursed one!)

GD_Undecided_63.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_63.text: Speak to the Emperor, entertain its tall tales if it suits you.

GD_Undecided_94.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_94.text: But do not forget my sacred mission. Vlaakith demands we sever the prince's blasphemous head.

GD_Undecided_55.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_55.text: Do this, and the queen's forces will aid us against the Netherbrain.

GD_Undecided_103.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_103.text: Speak to the Emperor if you must. But it will cajole you with empty promises, coax you with lies. There is only one answer it deserves:

GD_Undecided_58.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_58.text: I have your back. We will liberate Orpheus.

GD_Undecided_74.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_74.text: The Emperor will resist. It will lie, it will cajole - it might even beg. But there is only one answer it deserves:

GD_Undecided_61.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_61.text: Death. We will butcher the ghaik, and free Orpheus from its grasp. Gith's Heir will rise once more!

GD_Undecided_47.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_47.text: I have your back. We will slay Orpheus.

GD_Undecided_51.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_51.text: So it must be. Vlaakith demands we sever the prince's blasphemous head.

GD_Undecided_81.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_81.text: Without the Orphic Hammer, we may not be able to free the prince.

GD_Undecided_18.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_18.text: I will not let the prince suffer another moment in this infernal prison!

GD_Undecided_71.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_71.text: Gith's Heir will rise once more!

GD_Undecided_57.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_57.text: Without the Orphic Hammer, we may not be able to reach the prince, let alone kill him.

GD_Undecided_79.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_79.text: Hammer or not, Vlaakith will not be denied!

GD_Undecided_62.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_62.text: How would we free Orpheus? His cage is unbreakable.

GD_Undecided_59.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_59.text: I will find a way. The prince mustn't suffer another moment in this infernal prison!

GD_Undecided_127.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_127.text: We have no means of breaking Orpheus out. How will we kill him?

GD_Undecided_50.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_50.text: I will find a way. Vlaakith will not be denied!

GD_Undecided_112.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_112.text: Killing Orpheus could have disastrous consequences.

GD_Undecided_32.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_32.text: I made my promise. I will not fail my queen on the basis of groundless fears or fickle whims.

GD_Undecided_98.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_98.text: Do you expect the Emperor will just let Orpheus walk free?

GD_Undecided_20.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_20.text: I expect not. Which is why we will split the ghaik open and let his silver blood spill.

GD_Undecided_130.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_130.text: I made my promise. I will not fail Gith's son on the basis of groundless fears or fickle whims.

GD_Undecided_96.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_96.text: I guarantee that Vlaakith's kith'raki will fly to our aid. The lich queen will not abandon me in my moment of need.

GD_Undecided_2.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_2.text: The traitor prince is close. We must split him open; we must fulfil Vlaakith's command!

GD_Undecided_107.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_107.text: |But we're nut dead, so that means the show isn't over.|

GD_Undecided_95.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_95.text: The Emperor's plan failed - we need to come up with our own plan.

GD_Undecided_75.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_75.text: Let's hope the Emperor has a better plan.

GD_Undecided_84.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_84.text: |Hope wasn't very effective, given we're now here.|

GD_Undecided_65.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_65.text: |So we're going to need to place our pieces on the board, so to speak.|

GD_Undecided_15.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_15.text: We can make up our minds after we hear what the Emperor has to say.

GD_Undecided_49.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_49.text: |At least he seems to enjoy chatting more than brain eating.|

GD_Undecided_116.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_116.text: The Emperor has been manipulating us this whole time - it's proven it can't be trusted.

GD_Undecided_119.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_119.text: Whatever helps us defeat the Netherbrain, I'm open to it.

GD_Undecided_4.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_4.text: I'm not eager to unleash the orb - but if no other option presents itself...

GD_Undecided_99.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_99.text: We have another option - the orb. I could still put a stop to this... though at great cost.

GD_Undecided_19.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_19.text: You would bring us down with you? This is a coward's choice. Everything bleeds, the brain included, we just need to find where to strike it.

GD_Undecided_122.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_122.text: Now we free Orpheus. Perhaps he can help us succeed where the Emperor failed.

GD_Undecided_28.speaker: Player
GD_Undecided_28.text: |I don't know about you, but I wouldn't be so pleased being woken up after an eternity of prison time.|

MorphicPoolReturn_0.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Having just returned to the Morphic Pool, the player and Emperor look up. 
The brain is now gone, with a giant hole in the top of the cave.

MorphicPoolReturn_1.speaker: The Emperor
MorphicPoolReturn_1.text: It's gone to the city - we must follow. And hope we are not too late.
MorphicPoolReturn_1.context: NodeContext: Looking up then back at player

MorphicPoolReturn_2.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Having just returned to the Morphic Pool, the player looks up. 
The brain is now gone, with a giant hole in the top of the cave.

MorphicPoolReturn_5.speaker: Narrator
MorphicPoolReturn_5.text: *The air is damp, metallic, and unsettled. The Netherbrain has gone - its target, Baldur's Gate.*

MorphicPoolReturn_3.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Having just returned to the Morphic Pool, the player and Orpheus look up. 
The brain is now gone, with a giant hole in the top of the cave.

MorphicPoolReturn_4.speaker: Orpheus
MorphicPoolReturn_4.text: The abomination is on its way to the city - we must follow it and end it. Before it destroys everything.
MorphicPoolReturn_4.context: NodeContext: Looking up then back at player

AD_RaphaelAppears_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_RaphaelAppears_0.text: Here we all are, at the end of everything. The final stanza.
AD_RaphaelAppears_0.context: NodeContext: On arrival at a climactic scene in the endgame. Calm and collected.

RaphaelLastChance_50.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_50.context: NodeContext: amused - he's just appeared to the players in a climactic moment when they thought they were doomed, and he has the upper hand

RaphaelLastChance_74.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_74.text: When the ballads are composed and the history books are written, they'll commemorate your battle across the High Hall.
RaphaelLastChance_74.context: NodeContext: spinning a grand tale with a sting coming later

RaphaelLastChance_54.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_54.text: The blows you struck against the gods themselves will echo down through the ages.
RaphaelLastChance_54.context: NodeContext: spinning a grand tale with a sting coming later

RaphaelLastChance_52.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_52.text: The great hero of Baldur's Gate! Conqueror of the Netherbrain. Your deeds will be timeless.
RaphaelLastChance_52.context: NodeContext: not quite sarcastic, but he's puffing up the players for a fall

RaphaelLastChance_59.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_59.text: And nobody will ever know that your feeble-minded negligence almost doomed the world in the last moment.
RaphaelLastChance_59.context: NodeContext: and here's the sting - he just built up the players as heroes, but is reminding them that they have made a minor error that could doom them

RaphaelLastChance_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Raphael snaps his fingers and the hammer appears before him.|

RaphaelLastChance_29.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_29.text: The Orphic Hammer. You misplaced it.

RaphaelLastChance_69.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_69.text: Your absent-mindedness pains me more than your clumsy snooping in my home.

RaphaelLastChance_33.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_33.text: But I'll make sure the bards don't hear about this little moment of negligence. After all - we're associates in this great endeavour.
RaphaelLastChance_33.context: NodeContext: at his most charmingly insidious

RaphaelLastChance_64.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_64.text: It seems the aspiring heroes of Baldur's Gate have backed themselves into a rather uncomfortable corner.

RaphaelLastChance_58.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_58.text: Listen. Tune your minds beyond the frequency of the Prism's psychic collapse, and you can hear the sonorous, metronomic tick before the final tock.

RaphaelLastChance_48.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_48.text: The world's clock is winding down.

RaphaelLastChance_16.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_16.text: The grand finale has arrived, my friends, and thanks to you, I have a ringside seat.

RaphaelLastChance_21.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_21.text: How undignified. I prefer business to begging. You have brought yourself low.

RaphaelLastChance_17.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_17.text: And not for the first time. Your clumsy snooping in my House of Hope did not go unnoticed - the stench of deceit lingers so.

RaphaelLastChance_38.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_38.text: I have been more than generous in my dealings with you, and if you'd only listened, the brain would be dead, and you'd be sampling the contents of my wine cellar even now.

RaphaelLastChance_70.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_70.text: We could have been allies, partners... friends.

RaphaelLastChance_62.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_62.text: But that's all done with. Now, I dictate the terms, and you agree to them. Master and vassal.

RaphaelLastChance_75.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_75.text: You're going to do exactly what I tell you to, or in mere moments, the thing you've dreaded will finally come to pass.

RaphaelLastChance_46.speaker: Player
RaphaelLastChance_46.text: Tell me what you need me to do.

RaphaelLastChance_35.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_35.text: I provide the Orphic Hammer, with which you can free Prince Orpheus.

RaphaelLastChance_67.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_67.text: And when the brain is defeated, you seize the Crown and give it to me. Refuse, and I'll take your souls instead.

RaphaelLastChance_73.speaker: Narrator
RaphaelLastChance_73.text: *So it comes to this - the devil's final offer. And your last chance to face the Netherbrain and survive.*

RaphaelLastChance_27.speaker: Narrator
RaphaelLastChance_27.text: *At any other moment, the Crown of Karsus might seem too high a price. But to a desperate soul, Raphael's offer might even be considered charitable.*

RaphaelLastChance_15.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_15.text: Beautiful. With that single word you may have saved a billion lives - your own among them.

RaphaelLastChance_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael summons a floating contract, whcih appears in a burst of flames.

RaphaelLastChance_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tthe player signs the floating camera (back to camera), and then Raphael pops the Orphic Hammer into existance (also floating) and the player takes it.

RaphaelLastChance_31.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_31.text: Free Orpheus and follow his lead. Then give that Netherbrain hell.

RaphaelLastChance_71.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_71.text: I'll come to collect the Crown when you've triumphed.

RaphaelLastChance_42.speaker: Player
RaphaelLastChance_42.text: I don't like this, but I don't have a choice. Deal.

RaphaelLastChance_32.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_32.text: You don't need to like it - you're doing the right thing.

RaphaelLastChance_9.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_9.text: Why must you be so stubborn?

RaphaelLastChance_41.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_41.text: If you refuse me, in mere moments, the thing that you've dreaded will finally come to pass.

RaphaelLastChance_5.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_5.text: The city will burn - your world will die. But you will persist, a grey shadow. Without beauty, without heart, without self.

RaphaelLastChance_23.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_23.text: Dwelling in the ashes of dead worlds or in the space between stars, you will wander, endless. One among billions.

RaphaelLastChance_76.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_76.text: You have already become illithid, but you do not yet know what it is to be illithid. Soon, you will be a fragment of the hivemind, nothing more.

RaphaelLastChance_0.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_0.text: A survivor. A remnant. An illithid.

RaphaelLastChance_57.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_57.text: One of your companions is already lost - you will suffer the same fate.

RaphaelLastChance_53.speaker: Player
RaphaelLastChance_53.text: I'll find another way - I always do.

RaphaelLastChance_19.speaker: Player
RaphaelLastChance_19.text: I'd prefer to avoid that - what can I do?

RaphaelLastChance_7.speaker: Player
RaphaelLastChance_7.text: Sounds great - I might finally find some peace.

RaphaelLastChance_18.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_18.text: That may be. When the screaming stops and your mind is gone, the rest, perhaps, is silence.

RaphaelLastChance_4.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_4.text: Refuse me, and you'll soon know for sure.

RaphaelLastChance_39.speaker: Narrator
RaphaelLastChance_39.text: *He's telling the truth - you've never been more sure of anything.*

RaphaelLastChance_44.speaker: Player
RaphaelLastChance_44.text: What do you need me to do?

RaphaelLastChance_43.speaker: Player
RaphaelLastChance_43.text: Then maybe this is the end.

RaphaelLastChance_14.speaker: Player
RaphaelLastChance_14.text: Then maybe this is the end.

RaphaelLastChance_60.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_60.text: Then in mere moments all that you've dreaded will finally come to pass.

RaphaelLastChance_49.speaker: Player
RaphaelLastChance_49.text: Planning to spend these last moments mocking me?

RaphaelLastChance_61.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_61.text: I would love to, but you've already made quite a mockery of yourself.

RaphaelLastChance_55.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_55.text: But I assure you, enjoying the spectacle will be quite beyond you.

RaphaelLastChance_56.speaker: Raphael
RaphaelLastChance_56.text: In mere moments, all that you have dreaded will come to pass.

EmperorBetrayal_0.speaker: The Emperor
EmperorBetrayal_0.text: Do not seek me again - we are done. You will live with the consequences of your actions, for the little time you have left.
EmperorBetrayal_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor opens a portal and steps through it for the last time.

GD_TadpoleChoice_156.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_156.text: Sacrifice Orpheus, sacrifice the githyanki people to an eternity of Vlaakith's tyranny.

GD_TadpoleChoice_113.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_113.text: You will take the hammer, and you will smash the bonds that trap Gith's blessed spawn.

GD_TadpoleChoice_211.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_211.text: Orpheus will lead the charge against the Netherbrain. First, the Grand Design will be thwarted; next, the Comet will raze the Undying Queen!

GD_TadpoleChoice_131.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_131.text: If we're to defeat the brain, transformation may be the better option.

GD_TadpoleChoice_30.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_30.text: Do what you will. Do not expect me to stand quietly by.

GD_TadpoleChoice_161.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_161.text: Becoming a mind flayer seems unthinkable, after all we've done to avoid it.

GD_TadpoleChoice_54.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_54.text: Unthinkable, and unnecessary. I cannot have been clearer. You know what must be done.

GD_TadpoleChoice_26.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_26.text: We could give the stones to the Emperor. Better to trust a mind flayer than become one.

GD_TadpoleChoice_126.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_126.text: Freeing Orpheus may very well be the best option here.

GD_TadpoleChoice_166.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_166.text: We have no means of freeing Orpheus. What else can we do?

GD_TadpoleChoice_176.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_176.text: Today, the illithid falls and the Comet flies free. You either stand with me, or against me.

GD_TadpoleChoice_71.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_71.text: Enough talk. It's time to act.

GD_TadpoleChoice_36.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_36.text: The Emperor might be right, but we're not out of options yet.
GD_TadpoleChoice_36.context: InternalNodeContext: Node subject: We have an option: Me

GD_TadpoleChoice_189.text: Let me transform. I'm... I'm not long for this world. I can feel it.

GD_TadpoleChoice_12.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_12.text: All right. If this is what you really want, all I can say is thank you.

GD_TadpoleChoice_5.text: Freeing Orpheus may very well be the best option here.

GD_TadpoleChoice_135.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_135.text: The right choice, the only choice. The Prince of the Comet shall not just blaze a path for the githyanki - but for all who oppose the Grand Design.

GD_TadpoleChoice_178.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_178.text: You are my obsession, the one who has parted grey clouds to show me yellow sun. Now, I need you to be the Source of Salvation.

GD_TadpoleChoice_184.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_184.text: We have no means of freeing Orpheus. What else can we do?

GD_TadpoleChoice_35.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_35.text: We have no means because you refused to seek them. Orpheus is my people's last hope. Let him be destroyed, and you will know an even crueler death than his.

GD_TadpoleChoice_109.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_109.text: |We have the rare luxury of time here. Let's carefully consider all our options.|
GD_TadpoleChoice_109.context: InternalNodeContext: Node Subject: We will figure it out

GD_TadpoleChoice_155.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_155.text: We have no means because you refused to seek them. Orpheus is my people's last hope. Let him be destroyed, and you will know an even crueler death than his.

GD_TadpoleChoice_195.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_195.text: Maybe it's worth freeing Orpheus instead, Lae'zel.

GD_TadpoleChoice_78.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_78.text: I know my queen's mission. And I know neither storm nor sundering will keep me from it.

GD_TadpoleChoice_102.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_102.text: We have the Orphic Hammer. We could set the prince free.

GD_TadpoleChoice_93.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_93.text: And he would know freedom for but a moment before he fell to my weapon.

GD_TadpoleChoice_101.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_101.text: |It's hard to be certain, but he's our best bet.|
GD_TadpoleChoice_101.context: InternalNodeContext: Node subject: Better to at least try

GD_TadpoleChoice_33.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_33.text: Enough talk. It's time to act.

GD_TadpoleChoice_40.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_40.text: All right. It's agreed. All we can do now is hope it's right.
GD_TadpoleChoice_40.context: InternalNodeContext: Node subject: Hope for the best

GD_TadpoleChoice_192.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_192.text: Know this, without doubt: I will not hesitate do defend Orpheus if I must, even from you.

GD_TadpoleChoice_134.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_134.text: Know this, without doubt: I will not hesitate do defend Orpheus if I must, even from you.

GD_TadpoleChoice_88.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_88.text: Know this, without doubt: I will not hesitate do my queen's bidding. Should that mean your death and mine, so be it.

GD_TadpoleChoice_4.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_4.text: |Any choice is better than no choice at this point.|
GD_TadpoleChoice_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Node subject: Affirming player choice

GD_TadpoleChoice_64.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_64.text: Assimilate Orpheus, and you sin against the Mother to all githyanki. I will not let you take him.

GD_TadpoleChoice_45.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_45.text: |We worked hard enough to get that Orphic Hammer. We should at least consider putting it to use.|
GD_TadpoleChoice_45.context: InternalNodeContext: Node subjest: Point player to potentially using the hammer they brought with them

GD_TadpoleChoice_136.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_136.text: |We don't have many other options outside taking it's head.|
GD_TadpoleChoice_136.context: InternalNodeContext: Node subject: Re-establish why the player is the hero here

GD_TadpoleChoice_128.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_128.text: |You do whatever you want, but I'm not becoming a mind flayer.|
GD_TadpoleChoice_128.context: InternalNodeContext: Node subject: Re-establish why companion will not transform

GD_TadpoleChoice_31.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_31.text: We hold the means to the Prince's release and his killing. You cannot be beholden to this abominable ghaik.

GD_TadpoleChoice_46.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_46.text: Make the next moments count. They cannot be undone.

GD_TadpoleChoice_203.speaker: Player
GD_TadpoleChoice_203.text: The illithid threat needs to be destroyed from root to stem - I will not condone anyone volunteering for ceremorphosis.
GD_TadpoleChoice_203.context:
InternalNodeContext: Node subject: I am not turning into a mind flayer. 

Only the avatar can transform, this is going to be a question on the back of the players mind as they go through this dialog. Each character may have their own personal reasons not to be willing, but it needs to be a strong one since they may already be partially transformed. This can be used to further emphasis why the player is the hero of this story

AD_EmperorWaiting_0.speaker: The Emperor
AD_EmperorWaiting_0.text: The githyanki's power will see us through - one last time.

AD_EmperorWaiting_1.speaker: The Emperor
AD_EmperorWaiting_1.text: If we do not do this, all is lost.

AD_EmperorWaiting_2.speaker: The Emperor
AD_EmperorWaiting_2.text: Sometimes, freedom requires us to make sacrifices.

AD_EmperorWaiting_3.speaker: The Emperor
AD_EmperorWaiting_3.text: This may be our last chance to defeat the brain.
